image.altText: A 3d terrain map showing the mountains and the Fordow plant highlighted in orange

props.synopsis: Deep below a mountain in Iran sits a once-secret uranium enrichment facility which is threatening to drag the United States into the Israel-Iran conflict.

title.children: The key to Iran's nuclear program lies under these mountains

image.altText: Emergency personnel stand beside a damaged building.

props.synopsis: Eight days after Israel launched its first strikes, military chief Eyal Zamir warns of a lengthy and "complex campaign".

title.children: Israel warns of 'prolonged war' with Iran, as missile strikes Haifa

props.synopsis: As bombs fall on Tehran, Iranians speak of their fear and confusion about the situation now and what will come next.

title.children: Chaos and confusion amid the Israel-Iran conflict

image.altText: Image of UK military plane inside a base that has been damaged and spray painted with red paint by Pro-Palestinian activists

props.synopsis: British defence minister John Healey ordered an investigation and a review of wider security at the country's military bases.

title.children: Pro-Palestinian activists break into UK military base and damage planes

image.altText: A woman sleeps with a quilt on against a blue backdrop

props.synopsis: Felt like staying in bed longer this morning? It might be because the shorter days are affecting your circadian rhythm.

title.children: It's the shortest day of the year. Here's how that might be affecting your sleep

image.altText: A heater on the floor with two feet warming up next to it. The feet have socks on

props.synopsis: Tourists are stunned to discover they were warmer back in a country that's blanketed by snow for months of the year.

title.children: Even visitors from snowy countries realise Australian winters feel too cold

image.altText: Jim Chalmers responds to ABC Leaders Debate, federal election 20

props.synopsis: There was no mistaking the impression that the treasurer is emboldened by the election result and wants to seize his moment.

title.children: Jim Chalmers is eyeing his Paul Keating moment, but can he win a tax war?

image.altText: A person stands on the deck of a ship holding a white balloon in the air there is a large ice block and water in the background.

props.synopsis: Scientists are venturing to the Southern Ocean to study clouds and the world's cleanest air to better understand climate change and the impact of human activity on the Earth's atmosphere.

title.children: Hunting for clouds made in the purest air

image.altText: A woman milks a cow at a farm in India

props.synopsis: As India prepares to count its population and redraw the boundaries of its parliamentary constituencies, some states are pleading for their people to have more children.

title.children: Indian politicians offer cows and cash to encourage baby making

image.altText: The front of the protest line with the National Guard shields on full display.

props.synopsis: A US appeals court lets Donald Trump retain control on Thursday of California's National Guard while the state's Democratic governor proceeds with a lawsuit challenging the Republican president's use of the troops to quell protests in Los Angeles.

title.children: Trump can keep control of National Guard in LA, appeals court rules

image.altText: Renders of twin towers on the Gold Coast

props.synopsis: If the project is built, many of the 101-storey tower's luxury penthouses will look down on the spire of the Q1 building in nearby Surfers Paradise.

title.children: Developers lodge plans for Australia's tallest building on Gold Coast

image.altText: West Coast Eagles player Jeremy McGovern walks off the field with a bandage on his head.

props.synopsis: West Coast Eagles great Jeremy McGovern has played his final game, with the defender urged to retire by the AFL's concussion panel.

title.children: 'This is the way the game goes': AFL star retires due to concussions

image.altText: A man and woman slumping on their seats inside an airport

props.synopsis: Australians who were in Bali during a 2017 volcano eruption emphasise the importance of taking out travel insurance, following news of Mount Lewotobi Laki-Laki's eruption.

title.children: Australians stranded in Bali last time urge others not to repeat their mistake

image.altText: Tech start-up founder Julian Fayed with new staff member Tien Hung Nguyen.

props.synopsis: While overall employment is holding up, there are increasing signs that artificial intelligence is eating away at opportunities in some parts of the job market, especially for entry-level white-collar work.

title.children: 'We don't want to outsource what makes us human' as AI starts replacing workers

image.altText: Chris Brown in a suit walks in front of another man.

props.synopsis: Grammy-winning singer Chris Brown pleaded not guilty on Friday to a charge related to the serious beating of a music producer with a bottle in a London nightclub in 2023.

title.children: Chris Brown pleads not guilty to allegedly beating a music producer in a nightclub

props.synopsis: Over the AFLW off-season, Hawthorn's Tilly Lucas-Rodd underwent top surgery, a gender-affirming procedure that involves the removal of breast tissue in essentially a double mastectomy.

title.children: 'Huge dysphoria': First current AFLW player undergoes top surgery

image.altText: A woman in a purple jacket with large silver buttons sitting in an office chair.

props.synopsis: Attorney-General Deb Frecklington says she has moved to immediately suspend the director, Linzi Wilson-Wilde, pending a show cause notice for removal.

title.children: Forensic Science Queensland director suspended after 'contamination issues' identified

image.altText: Five empty chairs at NSW Parliament's Macquarie Room parliamentary inquiry into the alleged Dural caravan plot

props.synopsis: The committee will go to the president of the Legislative Council Ben Franklin to ask if he could request arrest warrants in the NSW Supreme Court.

title.children: Five NSW government staffers risk arrest over inquiry no-show

image.altText: A composite image of Joseph Dixon, a Black man wearing a suit and reading glasses, smiling, the 3 stars from Materialists

props.synopsis: ABC News gave the CEO and lead matchmaker at Bachelors Inc, Joseph Dixon an assignment — watch Materialists. Here's what he thinks of the movie, and he shares his advice for singles wanting to meet that perfect match.

title.children: A matchmaker's verdict on Materialists and his advice for singles

image.altText: Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto and Russian President Vladimir Putin during a meeting

props.synopsis: The decision comes after reports earlier this year that Moscow had lobbied Jakarta to house long-range bombers in the country's Papua province.

title.children: Why Indonesia's leader attended 'Russia's Davos' instead of the G7

image.altText: A generic stock photo of a group of teenage school girls on their phones, wearing formal school uniforms.

props.synopsis: A company contracted by the government to assess technologies for verifying the ages of online users says it can be done privately, robustly and effectively.

title.children: Trial finds age assurance can be done, as social media ban deadline looms

image.altText: A composite photo of Victorian opposition leader John Pesutto and former Liberal MP Moira Deeming.

props.synopsis: Former leader John Pesutto has expressed his gratitude to the Victorian Liberal Party after its administrative committee voted to lend him $1.55 million to pay his legal costs to MP Moira Deeming.

title.children: 'Grateful and humbled': Liberals save John Pesutto from bankruptcy

image.altText: A crash site showing strewn plane debris on country terrain.

props.synopsis: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau (ATSB) recently found that a 2023 triple-fatal crash near Cloncurry was "entirely preventable" after the pilot likely suffered hypoxia caused by a well-known, long-standing defect. So what is hypoxia and how common is it on planes?

title.children: What is hypoxia and why is it so dangerous on planes?

image.altText: Shriya Lohia sits on a racing car and gives the thumbs up.

props.synopsis: They're young, fast and fearless. These are the teenage girls making waves in India’s male-dominated motorsport circuits.

title.children: These young Indian women are shifting gears on what's expected of them

image.altText: Ricky Stuart and Jed Stuart embrace after win

props.synopsis: Coach Ricky Stuart's son Jed scores on his NRL debut as the Canberra Raiders hold on to defeat a fast-finishing Wests Tigers 16-12.

title.children: 'Made me cry': Stuart scores on debut for his father as Raiders hold off Tigers

image.altText: Brisbane AFL player Cam Rayner holds Dayne Zorko in the air as they celebrate a goal at Kardinia Park.

props.synopsis: The celebration for Patrick Dangerfield's 350th AFL game fall flat, as Brisbane downs Geelong at Kardinia Park to take back second spot on the ladder.

title.children: Lions spoil Danger's party at Kardinia Park, as Brisbane leapfrogs Geelong on ladder

image.altText: Indian Pacers player Tyrese Haliburton hugs former Pacers player Reggie Miller while surrounded by cameras at the NBA Finals.

props.synopsis: The NBA Finals are going to a deciding Game 7 for the first time in almost a decade after a dominant win by the Pacers over Oklahoma City Thunder tied the series at 3-3.

title.children: Pacers force first NBA Finals Game 7 since famous 2016 decider

image.altText: Alex Chidiac claps her hands after the Matildas played England in the FIFA Women's World Cup semifinal.

props.synopsis: Matildas coach Joe Montemurro has named a 33-player squad for upcoming friendlies with Slovenia and Panama, featuring a mix of old and new faces.

title.children: Matildas unveil new-look squad for Slovenia and Panama clashes

image.altText: Sussan Ley press conference smile

props.synopsis: To the extent anyone is paying attention, Sussan Ley has made a better start than many, including some Liberals, had expected.

title.children: Sussan Ley isn't dealing with the media like Peter Dutton did

image.altText: A red and white plane takes off into the sky with lights in the distance

props.synopsis: India's aviation regulator had warned the airline about a number of safety issues involving other planes in its fleet before last week's fatal crash.

title.children: Air India warned about fleet's safety issues before fatal Ahmedabad crash

image.altText: Two police cars parked on a suburban street

props.synopsis: A man tells a Perth murder trial his former friend fired three shots at a house in suburban Perth, killing an innocent man inside his own bedroom.

title.children: Debt collector in drug deal gone wrong blames ex-friend for man’s death

image.altText: A lady in a green jacket speaks to a crowd

props.synopsis: The man had accused Nationals MP Anne Webster and her husband of corruption and paedophilia, which a magistrate described as "conspiracy theory allegations".

title.children: Federal MP drops safety order request against One Nation supporter

image.altText: Police officers and vehicles behind tall palms on a hot-looking street.

props.synopsis: Police vow to "leave no stone unturned" in their search for answers after a woman's body was found on a Townsville street.

title.children: Police declare crime scene after woman's body found on busy street

image.altText: A hornbill looks through the bars of a cage. Others are visible in the background.

props.synopsis: The exotic pet industry is booming, fuelled by global demand for rare parrots, reptiles and other wild creatures — but in Solomon Islands, one of the Pacific's most active wildlife trading hubs, it is under growing scrutiny.

title.children: Plucked from a forest, sent to a cage: Behind the global exotic pet trade
